info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Polk County through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Columbus, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Tryon, Saluda, Chimney Rock State Park, Mill Spring and Lake Adger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
